► Sensor Used: Magnetometer (Magnetic Field Sensor)

 ► How it works: Detects changes in Earth's magnetic field caused by metal objects.

 ► The strength of earth's natural magnetic field ranges from 30 to 60 µTesla.

 ► General public should not be exposed on a continuous 100 µTesla.

 ► Magnetic fields for occupational exposures should be limited to less than 500 µTesla.

 ► Fun Fact: Your phone can detect magnetic changes as small as 0.1 µTesla!

► Sensor Used: Gravity Sensor (Software-based)

 ► How it works: Used accelerometer data with filtering to isolate gravitational force from motion.

 ► Earth's gravity is approximately 9.8 m/s²; downward

 ► This sensor helps determine device orientation and tilt.

 ► Fun Fact: Combines hardware (accelerometer) with smart algorithms to separate gravity from movement!

► Sensors Used: Accelerometer + Magnetometer (Fusion Sensor)

 ► How it works: Combines accelerometer and magnetometer data to calculate precise device orientation using rotation matrix.

 ► Pitch (Y-axis): Forward/backward tilt - like tilting your phone toward or away from you. Positive = tilted up, Negative = tilted down.

 ► Roll (X-axis): Left/right tilt - like rotating your phone clockwise or counterclockwise. Positive = tilted right, Negative = tilted left.

 ► Level Detection: When both pitch and roll are within tolerance range (±0.5° to ±5°), the bubble turns green and haptic feedback triggers.

 ► Features: Multiple sensitivity modes, haptic feedback, and real-time bubble physics simulation.

 ► Professional Use: Perfect for construction, carpentry, picture hanging, and any leveling task requiring precision.

 ► Fun Fact: Uses the same sensor fusion technology found in professional digital levels costing hundreds of dollars!
